III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff yelled and swore at youth.
Investigation On 1/30/2023 Complainant reported allegation to DCWL.
Complainant stated Youth A reported an incident that occurred on
1/22/2023 with Staff 2 at the Independent Living (IL) house. Per
Complainant Youth A stated he was sitting on the couch at the
home when Staff 2 arrived, in a bad mood. Staff 2 was hostile to
the clients and told Youth A to “go the f*** upstairs” when he was
not doing anything wrong. Staff 2 verbally escalated the situation
and began storming in and out of the house through the front
door. Youth A then locked the door behind (Staff 2), to prevent her
re-entry into the house. A male manager then arrived at the house
and sent Staff 2 home.
Youth A was interviewed in person by MDHHS courtesy worker on
1/31/2023, as Youth A moved out of the area prior to the
allegation being reported. Youth A is a juvenile justice, non-foster
care youth. Youth A has since moved two additional times and is
believed to be residing in an unknown hotel with his custodial
parent. During the MDHHS interview, Youth A reported Staff 2
would curse at the youth and violate their privacy by walking into
the bathroom during showers. Youth A would not elaborate on this
information. Youth A spent the remainder of the interview
discussing Staff 1. Youth A felt that Staff 2 told Staff 1 about the
incident on 1/22/2023. Therefore, Staff 1 retaliated against Youth
A on 1/23/23. The alleged retaliation was investigated by DCWL,
SIR 2023C0000208.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/7/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported he was not
present for any incident between Youth A and Staff 2. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 do not work the same shift. Staff 1 stated there was no
retaliation as a result of an incident between Youth A and Staff 2.
Staff 1 was unaware there was an issue until after Youth A left the
program on 1/23/23.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face the facility on 2/7/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported being present
2

for the incident between Youth A and Staff 2. Youth B was the
only other person in the house. At approximately 10:30pm on
1/22/23, Staff 2 arrived at the house. Youth A and Youth B were in
the living room. Staff 2 told them it was quiet time and they
needed to go to their rooms. Youth A started yelling and swearing
at Staff 2. Youth B told Youth A to calm down, stop arguing, and
go upstairs. Youth B reminded Youth A that he had a television
and game system in his room, so it was not a big deal. Youth B
then went to his bedroom. Youth A continued arguing and yelling.
Staff 2’s voice was loud, and could be heard over Youth A, but
Staff 2 was not threatening or aggressive. Youth B was unsure if
Staff 2 was swearing. After a few minutes Youth B no longer
heard yelling. Shortly after, Chief Administrator was at the house
and Staff 2 was gone. Youth B reported he has never heard Staff
2 swear at or threaten youth.
On 2/16/23 a follow-up phone call occurred with Youth B and
MDHHS worker to discuss Youth A’s report that Staff 2 would
violate youth privacy by entering the bathroom when they were
showering. Youth B denied ever witnessing this. Youth B reported
hearing stories from Youth A about this occurring to youth that
previously lived there. But Youth A never indicated who said it.
Youth B believed they were just made-up stories, as Youth A had
a lot of stories in general.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone on 2/10/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported entering the house on
1/22/23 and smelling marijuana. Staff 2 determined the smell was
coming from Youth A’s bedroom. Youth A denied smoking
anything. Staff 2 found tobacco packages and a vape pen in
Youth A’s room but did not locate marijuana. Staff 2 then went
downstairs with Youth A following, asking if Staff 2 was going to
tell his probation officer (PO). Staff 2 told Youth A she was not
sure, as she knew that Youth A was concerned about getting in
trouble with his PO and his behavior would likely escalate if she
said yes. Youth A began to escalate anyway and started yelling.
Staff 2 told Youth A he needed to calm down and go back to his
room, as it was almost 11:00pm. Staff 2 stated she was calm
when talking to Youth A, even though he was yelling. Staff 2 then
went out to her car to retrieve something she forgot . When she
came back in, Youth A was on the couch with the television
volume turned all the way up. Youth B was also present. Staff 2
asked Youth A to turn the television off. Youth A began screaming
at Staff 2. Youth B encouraged Youth A to quiet down, turn the
television off and go to his room. Staff 2 then turned off the
television. Youth B went back to his room. Youth A was upset and
3

yelling but went to his room also. Chief Administrator then arrived
at the house and took over. Staff 2 denied ever swearing at the
children and stated she was not yelling at Youth A. However, she
did raise her voice so he could hear her over the music and his
yelling.
On 2/16/23 a follow-up phone call occurred with Staff 2 and
MDHHS Worker to discuss Youth A’s allegation that Staff 2 did not
respect youth privacy and walked into the bathroom while they
showered. Staff 2 denied the allegation. Staff 2 reported she never
saw youth showering. Staff 2 recalled one time when she smelled
marijuana in the house and searched rooms she opened the
bathroom door, and a youth was standing there fully dressed, with
the shower running. Staff 2 immediately shut the door.
Analysis There was no information found to support a rule violation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
